sen.j: 矢川神社（やがわじんじゃ）は、滋賀県甲賀市甲南町森尻にある神社である。
sen.e: Yagawa-jinja Shrine stands in Morishiri, Konan-cho, Koka City.
Yagawa-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Morishiri, Konan-cho, Koka City.
Yagawa-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Morishiri, Konan-cho, Koka City.
The enshrined deity
The enshrined deity
The enshrined deity

sen.j: 大国主と矢川枝姫命（やがわえひめのみこと）を主祭神とする。
sen.e: The shusaijin (main enshrined deities) are Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) and Yagawaehime no miko.

The shusaijin (main enshrined deities) are Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) and Yagawaehime no miko.

The shusaijin (main enshrined deities) are Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) and Yagawaehime no miko.

sen.j: 大己貴命は殖産興業・健康長寿の神、矢川枝姫命は諸芸上達・諸願成就の神として信仰される。
sen.e: Onamuchi no mikoto has been believed as a God of flourishing new business as well as a God of health and longevity, and Yagawaehime no mikoto as a God of acquiring accomplishments as well as successful attainment.
sen.cmt: 本来「God」は絶対のもので、冠詞は「the」がつくものですが、日本では「何々の神」はたくさん存在するものとみなし、ここでは冠詞「a」を用いました。
sen.e: Onamuchi no mikoto is believed as the god of encouragement of new business and healthy longevity, and Yagawaehime no mikoto is as the god of development of performance and wish fulfillment.

Onamuchi no mikoto is worshipped as the god of encouragement of new business and healthy longevity, and Yagawaehime no mikoto is worshipped as the god of development of performance and wish fulfillment.
sen.cmt: Neilさん、「大己貴命は～信仰される」の「信仰される」は believed -> worshippedとしました。

sen.j: 矢川枝姫命は八河江比売、矢河枝比売とも記されている。
sen.e: Yagawaehime no mikoto has also been described as 八河江比売, or 矢河枝比売.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yagawaehime no mikoto is also described as 八河江比売 or 矢河枝比売 in Chinese characters.
Yagawaehime no mikoto is also described as 八河江比売 or 矢河枝比売 in Chinese characters.

sen.j: 古事記の大国主の系譜の中に「大国主が葦那陀迦神（あしなだがのかみ）またの名を八河江比売を娶って生ませた子は速甕之多気佐波夜遅奴美神（はやみかのたけさはやじぬみのかみ）」という記述がある。
sen.e: The genealogy of Okuninushi in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) described that Okuninushi married Ashinadaga no kami (the God of Ashinadaga), or Yagawaehime no mikoto, and had a child named Hayamikanotakesahayajinumi no kami (the God of Hayamikanotakesahayajinumi).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The genealogy of Okuninushi in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) described that 'Okuninushi married Ashinadaga no kami (the God of Ashinadaga), or Yagawaehime no mikoto, and had a child named Hayamikanotakesahayajinumi no kami (the God of Hayamikanotakesahayajinumi).'
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い、""を外しました。
sen.e: The genealogy of Okuninushi in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) described that 'Okuninushi married Ashinadaga no kami (the God of Ashinadaga), or Yagawaehime no mikoto, and had a child named Hayamikanotakesahayajinumi no kami (the God of Hayamikanotakesahayajinumi).'

sen.j: また、古事記の応神天皇条に、応神天皇の妃の一人として宮主矢河枝比売の名が見える。
sen.e: Also, in the article of Emperor Ojin in "Kojiki", the name of Miyanushiyakawaehime was described as one of the princess of Emperor Ojin.
Also, in the article concerning Emperor Ojin in Kojiki, the name of Miyanushiyakawaehime was described as one of the princesses of Emperor Ojin.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い""を外し、前置詞を変更、複数形に修正しました。
sen.e: Also, in the article concerning Emperor Ojin in Kojiki, the name of Miyanushiyakawaehime was described as one of the princesses of Emperor Ojin.
History
History
History

sen.j: 社伝では、創建は天平年間、聖武天皇の紫香楽宮造営のときと伝える。
sen.e: The shrine's biography told that this shrine had been found in the Tenpyo era, when the Shigaraki no miya had been constructed by Emperor Shomu.
The shrine's biography tells that this shrine was found in the Tenpyo era when the Shigaraki no miya was constructed by Emperor Shomu.
The shrine's biography tells that this shrine was found in the Tenpyo era when the Shigaraki no miya was constructed by Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では近江国甲賀郡8座の筆頭に記載され、小社に列している。
sen.e: Jinmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) described this shrine as the first on a list of eight shrines in Koga gun (county), Omi Province and listed as small shrine.

Jinmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) describes this shrine as the first on a list of eight shrines in Koga gun (county), Omi Province and lists it as a small shrine.

Jinmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) describes this shrine as the first on a list of eight shrines in Koga gun (county), Omi Province and lists it as a small shrine.

sen.j: 江戸時代には水口藩の崇敬社とされた。
sen.e: In the Edo period it was considered as 崇敬社 of Minakuchi Domain.
In the Edo period it was considered as a sukei no yashiro (literally means a shrine of reverence) of Minakuchi Domain.
sen.cmt: 崇敬社（すうけいのやしろ）：a sukei no yashiro (literally means a shrine of reverence) としました。
sen.e: In the Edo period it was considered as a sukei no yashiro (literally means a shrine of reverence) of Minakuchi Domain.

sen.j: 天保13年（1842年）、当社社頭に数万の農民が集まり幕府の検地に反対して決起した「甲賀騒動」が起こった。
sen.e: In 1842 " Koka incident" occurred, in which tens of thousands of farmers got together and were roused to action in front of the main building of this shrine opposing to the land survey by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

In 1842 occurred 'Koka incident' where tens of thousands of farmers got together in front of the main building of this shrine and rose against the land survey by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

In 1842 the 'Koka incident' occurred, in which tens of thousands of farmers got together in front of the main building of this shrine and rose against the land survey conducted by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
